issues.description: Register name inconsistency: the problem statement instructs students to change 'ecc' to 'edx' (problem_statement.md line 17), while the template's TODO comment instructs changing 'ecc' to 'ecx' and the template code contains 'add eax, ecc' (template_repository/helloWorld.asm lines 12-14). The solution uses 'add eax, ecx' (solution_repository/helloWorld.asm line 17). This mismatch between 'edx' and 'ecx' will confuse students which register to use and may lead to incorrect edits or compilation failures if they follow the wrong instruction.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the register name consistent across all artifacts. The easiest fix is to update the problem statement (problem_statement.md line 17) to instruct changing 'ecc' to 'ecx' to match the template comment and the provided solution. Alternatively, if 'edx' was intended, update both the template (replace 'ecx' in the TODO/comment and the solution code) and the solution to use 'edx' everywhere. Ensure the template code, template comments, solution code, and problem text all use the same register name.

issues.description: The problem statement instructs students to change the identifier/register 'ecc' to 'edx' (problem_statement.md line 17), while the template's TODO comment and the solution use 'ecx' (template_repository/helloWorld.asm line 12-13 and solution_repository/helloWorld.asm line 16-17). This refers to the same conceptual entity (the CPU register name to use in the add instruction) but uses two different register names ('edx' vs 'ecx'), which can confuse students about the correct change to make and which final solution is intended.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the register name consistent across artifacts. Update the problem statement to instruct changing 'ecc' to 'ecx' (replace 'edx' with 'ecx'), which matches the template comment and the solution implementation. Alternatively, change template and solution to use 'edx' if that was the intended target, but aligning everything to 'ecx' is the least disruptive fix given the provided solution.
